Test Steps:
1-Open Postman
2-Set Method to GET
3-Enter the endpoint URL
4-Click Send
5-Observe the response and status code
Expected result:
- Status 200 OK
- List of products returns with correct fields

Test Steps:
1-Open Postman
2- Set Method to POST
3.-Enter endpoint /products
4.-Click Send
5.-Observe status code and error message

1- Open Postman
2- Set Method to GET
3- Enter wrong endpoint /product
4- Click Send
5- Observe status code and error message

1- Open Postman
2- Set Method GET
3- Enter endpoint /products
4- Click Send
5-Verify each product in response has all required fields with correct type
Expected result:
Each product must have:
- id (Number)
- title (String)
- slug (String)
- price (Number)
- description (String)
- category (Object with id, name, slug, image, creationAt, updatedAt)
- images (Array)
- creationAt (Date)
- updatedAt (Date)

Test Steps:
1- Open Postman
2-Set Method GET
3- Enter endpoint /products
4- Click Send
5- Observe response headers
Expected result:
- Access-Control-Allow-Origin = *
- Content-Type = application/json; charset=utf-8
- Strict-Transport-Security present
- X-Content-Type-Options = nosniff
- X-Frame-Options = SAMEORIGIN
- Content-Security-Policy present
- Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy = same-origin
- Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy = same-origin
